snippet.title: Airport Simulator 2014 (100% Completed) PC Gameplay FullHD 1440p
snippet.description:
Airport Simulator 2014
Genre: Simulation
Developer: UIG Entertainment
Publisher: UIG Entertainment
Release Date: 19 Dec 2013
Platform: Windows
Mode: Single player
Link: http://www.uieg.de/index.php/airport-simulator-2014.html
Steam link: http://store.steampowered.com/app/267600/

Booming turbine noise, kerosene smells in the air and constant change and new challenges: The daily life of a large airport is perfectly presented and is a particular challenge in this professional and economic airport simulation.

Whether refueling super jumbos, or coordinating air traffic controllers and technical staff, or even organizing perfect catering: The Management of this airport will always have new challenges for you!

Features:
-The most detailed and comprehensive simulation of the events at an international airport
-Many management and business options for the expansion of terminals and extension of runways
-Countless missions and tasks that the player has to fulfill in order to guarantee a successful airport 

Minimum System Requirements:
OS: Windows XP / 7 / Vista / 8
Processor: 2,4 GHz Pentium or 100% compatible CPU
Memory: 2 GB RAM
Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 6800GT, ATI Radeon HD 3650
DirectX: Version 9.0c
Hard Drive: 200 MB available space 

Recommended System Requirements:
OS: Windows XP / 7 / Vista / 8
Processor: 3,0 GHz Pentium or 100% compatible CPU
Memory: 4 GB RAM
Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTX 560, ATI Radeon HD 6970
DirectX: Version 9.0c
Hard Drive: 200 MB available space 

*My Review* 
 There were plenty of hours where I just waited doing nothing because all I could do was wait. I waited for scheduled planes to start with wait times of well over an hour each with some menial cargo work added in just to keep you watching the screen. I had only 8 minutes to load/unload cargo on a cargo plane but it took the ai well over 60 minutes to load/unload passengers from a passenger plane.
This game also had the most bugs I have ever seen. Extend tunnels collapsing, stairs colliding with planes, invisible cargo, terrible schedule algorithms and glitchy 2004-like graphics were just a few game-ending bugs guaranteed to make me restart my game every ten minutes. I saved/restarted well over a hundred times in the game. There were enough errors to test even the toughest gamer's mettle but with plenty of patience and perseverance and despite all the glitches, I finally finished Airport Simulator 2014. I just had to. Don't ask why! I've highlighted some of the game's best features in this video. Enjoy.

To watch in best quality just click on the quality tab and choose '1440p'

Subscribe to Dali HD Gaming channel:
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=mtvkriar91

Subscribe to Dali HD Gaming 2nd channel:
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=dalihdgaming

Google+ Community:
https://plus.google.com/communities/114526689102521245587

Google+: https://plus.google.com/101372516019068599825/posts/p/pub

Twitter: https://twitter.com/DaliHDGaming

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/DaliHdGaming?ref=hl

Follow me on Blogger: http://dalihdgaming.blogspot.com/

PC Specs:
MoBo:          Gigabyte GA-Z68XP-UD4 B3 dual bios 
CPU:            Intel i7 2600K 3.4 GHz (oc to 4.2 GHz)
GPU:            Asus GeForce GTX-580 Direct CU II (oc to 911 Mhz)
RAM:           Corsair Vengeance DDR3 16gb 1600Mhz cl9 timing 9-9-9-24
PSU:            XFX 850w Black Edition 80+ Silver 12v single rail
SOUND:      Asus Xonar DX Pci-e
SSD:            OCZ 128GB Vertex IV 128GB
HDD             WD Caviar Black 2TB 64MB 6gbs 7200rpm
HDD             WD Green 1TB 64MB 3gbs 7200rpm
CASE:          Thermaltake Chaser MK-1 Full Tower
COOLER:     Corsair H80 Liquid Cooler with 2 x120mm stock fans push/pull rear intake
FANS:           2x200mm top exhaust -1x180mm front intake - 1x200mm left sidepanel intake
OS:               Windows® 7 64-bit
